messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

laptop issues assessment re issues hello please bring further investigation regarding issue mentioned regarding mentioned issue change considering age battery good consider issue please battery help details keyboard please let kind liquid water coffee juice etc has spilled near over keyboard please provide error codes screens also mandatory work suggest rebuild coming giving clean work environment keep mind issues treated also code which log spent rebuild has almost years months mentioned suffice needs suggest retire kind regards engineer ext friday pm re issues hi problem assessment made thank senior tester re issues hi needs make assessment please help issues kind regards administrator friday pm issues hello having issues drive low free out everything continue perform area order free megabytes note machine has installed by battery drops about key has frequent moments which few screen errors possible replacement other currently working code details name model os also where directed question then apologies please let where forward regards senior tester

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT Support Tickets**

I need to classify the IT ticket into one of the provided categories: Hardware, HR Support, Access, Miscellaneous, Storage, Purchase, Internal Project, and Administrative Rights. The user submitted a lengthy ticket regarding laptop issues, including battery damage and keyboard problems due to a liquid spill. Based on the details, the "Hardware" category fits best. I should format my response in JSON as required, saying: {"category":"Hardware"}. A brief reasoning could enhance the response.**Outputting JSON Format**

The instructions are clear: I need to provide my output in a JSON format with a category property using specific enum values. There shouldn't be any extra text in my response. So, I will finalize my output as: {"category":"Hardware"}, making sure to include the quotes exactly as required. I want to get this right, so following the instructions without any additions is important. Let's stick to the format!
